title: How to Make Felt Puppets

steps.headline: Make a basic template for the head piece.
steps.description: This is very simple; just draw a semi-circle shape that is wide enough to fit over the child's fingertips and long enough to reach just before the knuckle. This will be your basic template for any head you choose to make, be it animal or human.

steps.headline: Place the template on the felt.
steps.description: Pin in place. Cut around it twice.

steps.headline: Stitch the two pieces together, stitching only around the curve.
steps.description: Leave the straight edges unstitched; this is where the child inserts a finger.

steps.headline: Make ears.
steps.description: Ears can be triangles, half circles, bunny ears, floppy ears, elephant ears, etc. Simply cut the required shape from felt in the same color as the head. Glue in place. Also cut inner ear pieces from a different color of felt. Glue inside the ear shape.

steps.headline: Add eyes, nose and mouth.
steps.description: These can be made from felt or from items such as buttons, googly eyes, sequins, thread, etc. Again, after cutting the shape (if needed), simply glue the item in place.

steps.headline: Choose a design for the head finger puppet.
steps.description:
Here the possibilities are endless but some ideas include:
Pig - pink felt, triangle ears, round snout from felt with a button glued on top, googly eyes
Mouse - grey felt, triangle ears with pink felt inner ears, googly eyes, triangle nose, felt or embroidery thread whiskers
Elephant - grey felt, ears shaped like a filled-in figure 8, pink inner ears, trunk made from grey felt with fabric pen marked lines (or sew with thread), googly eyes
Dog - Brown felt, floppy triangle ears that fold over onto the face, googly eyes, oval snout in same color as felt, with a black spot for a nose
Cat - Black felt, green cat's eyes cut from felt, triangle ears with pink felt inserts, felt or embroidery thread whiskers, triangle nose in pink felt
Girl or boy (basic person) - Skin color of choice, eyes cut from felt in eye color of choice, red or pink smiling mouth cut from felt, cheek dimples (round felt pieces), etc. Add hair in the form of yarn glued around the face from top, down; braids, etc. can extend down the face area if wished, just be sure to tie firmly so that they do not unravel

steps.headline: Mix and match different styles of ears, eyes, etc., to give the puppet its own personality.
steps.description: Consider adding other features, such as a hat, a tiara, a Santa cap, earrings, eyelashes, etc.

steps.headline: Make a template.
steps.description: Draw a rectangle onto cardboard to use as a template. Make the rectangle wider than the finger and about 2.5cm/1 inch longer than the finger. At one end of the rectangle, round it off––this becomes the top or head section of the finger puppet.

steps.headline: Cut out the template.
steps.description: Take care to round it off neatly. This is now the basic template for placing on the felt fabric.

steps.headline: Cut out two pieces of felt fabric following the cardboard template.
steps.description: Each two pieces of felt forms one finger puppet, both head and body in one.

steps.headline: Match and stitch the two pieces of felt fabric together.
steps.description: Leave the straight end of the rectangle unsewn; this is the entry for the finger.

steps.headline: Decorate the finger puppet.
steps.description: This is the fun part but you do need to know what you want to turn the finger puppet into, such as a person or animal, and then decide what sorts of features, clothing, fur, hair, etc. the finger puppet will have. Use yarn for hair and fur. Use googly eyes or felt shapes for eyes. Use felt shapes or fabric markers to make facial features such as a smile, nose, teeth, etc. Make clothing using different colors of felt, fabric scraps, lace, ribbon, fabric paint (three-dimensional paint is a good choice), etc.
